questions.subject: Biology
questions.question: Which of the following organelles is known as the powerhouse of the cell?
questions.hint: This organelle is responsible for cellular respiration and ATP production
questions.solution: Mitochondria are called the powerhouse of the cell because they produce energy in the form of ATP through cellular respiration. They have a double membrane structure and contain their own DNA. The inner membrane is folded to form cristae which increase the surface area for ATP production.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: Which of the following electronic configurations represents the ground state of Fe²⁺ ion?
questions.hint: Consider the neutral Fe configuration and removal of electrons to form Fe²⁺
questions.solution: Neutral Fe has configuration [Ar]3d⁶4s². When forming Fe²⁺, electrons are first removed from 4s orbital before 3d. So, both 4s electrons are removed, leaving [Ar]3d⁶4s⁰ as the ground state configuration of Fe²⁺.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A person has a far point at 200 cm. What is the power of lens needed to correct this defect?
questions.hint: Use P = -1/far point (in meters) for myopia
questions.solution:
For myopia correction:
P = -1/far point (in meters)
Far point = 200 cm = 2 m
P = -1/2 = -0.5 D
A concave lens of power -0.5 diopter is needed

questions.subject: Biology
questions.question: In a dihybrid cross between AABB × aabb, what proportion of the F2 generation will show both dominant phenotypes?
questions.hint: Use the Punnett square method and consider the 9:3:3:1 ratio
questions.solution:
In F1 generation, all plants will be AaBb
In F2, when AaBb × AaBb:
Possible phenotype ratios are 9:3:3:1
9/16 show both dominant traits (A_B_)
3/16 show only dominant A (A_bb)
3/16 show only dominant B (aaB_)
1/16 show both recessive (aabb)
Therefore, 9/16 of F2 will show both dominant phenotypes

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question: What is the IUPAC name of CH₃-CH=CH-CHO?
questions.hint: Consider the longest carbon chain containing the functional group and numbering from the aldehyde group
questions.solution:
1. Identify the functional group: aldehyde (-CHO)
2. Find longest carbon chain: 4 carbons (but-)
3. Double bond is between C2 and C3 when numbered from aldehyde end
4. Add suffix -al for aldehyde
Therefore, the IUPAC name is but-2-enal

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A wire of resistance 8Ω is bent in the form of a circle. The effective resistance between two points at the ends of any diameter of the circle is:
questions.hint: Consider parallel combination of two semicircular arcs
questions.solution:
When measuring across diameter:
1. The circle splits into two parallel semicircular paths
2. Each semicircle has resistance = 4Ω (half of total resistance)
3. These semicircles are in parallel
4. Using parallel resistance formula:
1/R = 1/4 + 1/4 = 2/4
R = 2Ω

questions.subject: Biology
questions.question: Which hormone is responsible for maintaining the circadian rhythm in humans?
questions.hint: This hormone is secreted by the pineal gland and its secretion is influenced by light/dark cycles
questions.solution:
Melatonin is the key hormone responsible for circadian rhythm:
1. Secreted by pineal gland
2. Production increases in darkness
3. Suppressed by light exposure
4. Regulates sleep-wake cycle
5. Peaks at night (around 2-3 AM)
6. Helps maintain daily biological rhythms
